title: Camping made glamorous: Glamp it up this autumn
text:
Enjoy peace in a Hideaway Hut set in Cornish farmland 
HIDEAWAY HUTS, CORNWALL 
Hideaway Huts are two delightful shepherd’s huts with real fires that are perfect for a romantic break. 
Each has its own luxury bathroom hut nearby. Just a few miles from the coast, they offer tranquil walks through the farm’s 150 acres with river views and woodland trails. 
There are on-site facilities including horse riding for all levels, a games room and tennis courts. Homemade meals and treats can be delivered to the door for an extra charge. 
? Premier Cottages (as before) offers seven nights from £418 (sleeps two). Cornwall tourism: visitcornwall.com 
FARM HUT, GWYNEDD 
Sitting in the foothills of the Rhinog mountain range near Barmouth, North Wales, the Farm Hut is a new, handcrafted shepherd’s hut that offers cosy accommodation for two. 
Inside it has all the mod cons including a kitchen with a butler sink and double hob, dining area, double bed with luxurious bedding, and an en suite with wash basin, flush toilet and electric shower. 
Outside, there is a seating area with barbecue and a wood- burning fi repit. Guests can stroll along the beautiful beaches of the Llyn Peninsula, marvel at the impressive backdrop of Snowdonia or admire the breathtaking Cambrian coast panorama. 
Spend autumn nights in front of the fi repit with a glass of wine or hot chocolate listening to the sounds of the waves. 
? Pitchup (as above) offers four nights at The Farm Hut from £320 (sleeps two). Gwynedd tourism: gwynedd.com 
YEALM CABIN, DEVON 
Overlooking the Yealm Valley in the sublime South Hams in Devon, Yealm Cabin is ideal for couples or families and even the family dog. 
The lodge, not far from the sea, has countryside views and a fully-equipped kitchen, bathroom and wi-fi , plus a private courtyard. Bracing autumn walks can be enjoyed along the scenic South West Coast Path and gorgeous Mothecombe Beach is three miles away. 
Bigbury beach, where surfing lessons are available, is also nearby. 
After a day exploring Devon’s treasures, enjoy a hearty meal at a local pub or head back to base and stargaze from Yealm Cabin’s own observatory. 
You can even arrange to look up at the sky at night in the company of a local astronomy expert. 
Pitchup (pitchup.com) offers two nights at Yealm Cabin from £170 (sleeps five). Devon tourism: visitdevon.com PH A Coastal Cabin in Devon 
COASTAL CABINS, DEVON 
Five cool, pale timber cabins set above the stunning coast, sitting around a picturesque fishing lake. 
There are king-sized beds for the adults and bunks for the children, a kitchenette and en suite shower room, plus a TV. 
Double glazing and heating ensure the cabins stay cosy, whatever the weather. The decked area is the perfect place to barbecue and admire the views. 
Walk around the lake or visit Berry Beach, easily accessible from the coastal path, with lots of rock pools to explore. 
Evenings can be spent tucking into delicious food at the nearby Hartland pub. 
? Premier Cottages (01237 411407 premiercottages.co.uk ) offers Coastal Cabins for seven nights from £455 (sleeps four). Devon tourism: visitdevon.com Related articles
